faqs.q: How many calories in an old fashioned cocktail?
faqs.a: Approximately 155 calories for a standard serving.

faqs.q: What contributes most to calories in an Old Fashioned?
faqs.a: The bourbon (about 140 kcal from 2 oz) and sugar cube (15 kcal) are the main sources.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in an old fashioned cocktail?
faqs.a: Yes, about 10.5 g of carbs, all from added sugars; no fiber.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in Old Fashioned cocktails?
faqs.a: Higher proof bourbon increases calories (e.g., 100 proof adds ~20 kcal vs. 80 proof).

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie Old Fashioned?
faqs.a: Yes, reduce bourbon to 1.5 oz or use a sugar substitute to cut ~40-50 kcal.
